definition:
The *connected sum of knots* $K$ and $J$ is a knot, denoted by $K\#J$,
constructed by removing a short segment from each of $K$ and $J$ and
joining each free end of $K$ to a different free end of $J$ to form a
new knot. The connected sum of two knots always exists but is not
necessarily unique.

The *connected sum of oriented knots* $K$ and $J$ is a connected sum of
knots which has a consistent orientation inherited from that of $K$ and
$J$. This sum always exists and is unique.

Suppose $K$ and $J$ are both the trefoil knot.

![The trefoil knot](TrefoilKnotPF2007)

By one choice of segment deletion and reattachment, $K\#J$ is the
quatrefoil knot.

![$K\#J$ is the quatrefoil knot](QuatrefoilKnotPF2007)
